item.title: Tractor Beams: A possibility?
item.author: Jacob Ward,
item.description: Researchers at the University of New York have conducted the first experimental demonstration of a tractor beam – a travelling wave that comes from one direction and pulls its target towards the beam’s origin. Up until now, beams have been used to move particles by working as optical tweezers and …

item.title: Suffer from hayfever? A solution may be at hand...
item.author: Jacob Ward,Philippa M Skett,Annina M Sartor,Maciej Matuszewski,Mimi Li,Philip Kent,
item.description: What is hayfever? A little history… First scientifically described in 1819 by John Bostock, hay fever, also known as allergic rhinitis, is an allergic reaction to small particles in the air that most commonly causes nasal inflammation but may also result in watery eyes and itching throat. …
